sen.j: 橘 古那可智（たちばな の こなかち、生年不詳 - 天平宝字3年7月5日 (旧暦)（759年8月21日））は、聖武天皇の夫人。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Konakachi (year of birth unknown - August 21, 759) was the consort of Emperor Shomu.
TACHIBANA no Konakachi (year of birth unknown - August 6, 759) was the consort of Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 天平宝字3年7月5日は西暦759年8月6日です。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Konakachi (year of birth unknown - August 6, 759) was the consort of Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 正四位下中宮職橘佐為の娘。
sen.e: She was the daughter of TACHIBANA no Sai, Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Chugushiki (office of the consort's household).
She was a daughter of TACHIBANA no Sai, Shoshiinoge Chugushiki (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade, office of the consort's household).
She was a daughter of TACHIBANA no Sai, Shoshiinoge Chugushiki (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade, office of the consort's household).

sen.j: 県犬養三千代の孫娘で、正一位左大臣橘諸兄の姪。
sen.e: She was the granddaughter of Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo, and the niece of TACHIBANA no Moroe, Shoichii Sadaijin (Senior First Rank, Minister of the Left).
She was a granddaughter of Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo, and a niece of TACHIBANA no Moroe, Shoichii Sadaijin (Senior First Rank, Minister of the Left).
sen.cmt: the granddaughter -> a granddaughterthe niece -> a niece
sen.e: She was a granddaughter of Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo, and a niece of TACHIBANA no Moroe, Shoichii Sadaijin (Senior First Rank, Minister of the Left).
She was called "Tachibana-fujin".
She was called Tachibana-fujin.
She was called Tachibana-fujin.

sen.j: 天平9年（737年）2月に無位から従三位に叙せられており、この時期に聖武天皇の夫人となったと思われる。
sen.e: She was raised from no rank to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in February 737, so it can be inferred that she became the consort of Emperor Shomu around that time.
She was promoted from no rank to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in March 737, so it can be inferred that she became the consort of Emperor Shomu around that time.
sen.cmt: raised -> promoted天平9年2月は西暦737年3月です。
sen.e: She was promoted from no rank to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in March 737, so it can be inferred that she became the consort of Emperor Shomu around that time.

sen.j: 同時に父佐為も従四位上から正四位下に昇進している。
sen.e: At the same time, her father Sai was also raised from Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) to Shoshiinoge.
At the same time, her father Sai was also promoted from Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) to Shoshiinoge.
At the same time, her father Sai was also promoted from Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) to Shoshiinoge.

sen.j: 天平21年（749年）4月、正三位から従二位に昇進した。
sen.e: In April 749, she was promoted from Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) to Junii (Junior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 原文の「正三位」は「従三位」？
sen.e: In April 749, she was promoted from Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) to Junii (Junior Second Rank).
In April 749, she was promoted from Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) to Junii (Junior Second Rank).

sen.j: その後、正二位に昇叙される。
sen.e: Then she was conferred with Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, she was conferred Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
Later, she was conferred Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 橘奈良麻呂の乱が起こった2ヵ月後の天平宝字元年（757年）閏8月、妹橘真都我や同族とともに橘氏を改めて広岡氏朝臣姓を賜った。
sen.e: In August 757, two months after the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, her family (including her younger sister Matsuga) changed the family name TACHIBANA to HIROOKA no Ason.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In September 757, two months after the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, her family (including her younger sister Matsuga) changed the name TACHIBANA to HIROOKA no Ason.
sen.cmt: 天平宝字元年閏8月は西暦757年9月です。
sen.e: In September 757, two months after the revolt of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, her family (including her younger sister Matsuga) changed the name TACHIBANA to HIROOKA no Ason.

sen.j: 天平宝字3年（759年）7月5日に薨去したが、このときは「夫人正二位広岡朝臣古那可智」と記載されている。
sen.e: She passed away on July 5, 759, which was recorded by the name of "Fujin Shonii HIROOKA no Ason no Konakachi".
sen.cmt: 「夫人正二位広岡朝臣古那可智」の読み方不明
sen.e: She passed away on August 6, 759, and her death was recorded by the name of 'Fujin Shonii HIROOKA no Ason Konakachi'.
sen.cmt: 広岡朝臣古那可智は用語集を参照して、「ひろおかのあそんこなかち」としています。
sen.e: She passed away on August 6, 759, and her death was recorded by the name of 'Fujin Shonii HIROOKA no Ason Konakachi'.

sen.j: 聖武天皇との間に皇子女はいなかった。
sen.e: She and Emperor Shomu had no prince or princess.
She had neither prince nor princess with Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: She had neither prince nor princess with Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 仏教に篤く帰依し、天平14年（742年）2月に韓櫃などの調度を、また同18年（746年）5月に『薬師経』などをそれぞれ法隆寺に施入した。
sen.e: She was a devout believer in Buddhism and offered furniture such as Karabitsu (container) in February 742, and "Yakushi-kyo Sutra" in May 746 to Horyu-ji Temple.
She was a devout Buddhist and offered furniture such as Karabitsu (container with ornament) in March 742, and "Yakushi-kyo Sutra" in May 746 respectively to Horyu-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 天平14年2月は西暦742年3月です。韓櫃は container with ornament としました。
sen.e: She was a devout Buddhist and offered furniture such as Karabitsu (container with ornament) in March 742, and "Yakushi-kyo Sutra" in May 746 respectively to Horyu-ji Temple.

sen.j: また天平勝宝4年（752年）4月の東大寺盧舎那仏像開眼法会にも刀子・琥碧誦数を献じた。
sen.e: In April 752, she also offered Tosu (small knife) and an amber beadroll for the eye-opening mass of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple.
In May 752, she also offered Tosu (small knife) and an amber beadroll for the eye-opening ritual of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 天平勝宝4年4月は西暦752年5月です。mass -> ritual
sen.e: In May 752, she also offered Tosu (small knife) and an amber beadroll for the eye-opening ritual of the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 大和国添上郡広岡（奈良県奈良市法蓮町）にある普光寺は、古那可智が聖武天皇のために建立したといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that she built Fukoji Temple in Hirooka, Soegami-gun, Yamato Province (present-day Horen-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture) for Emperor Shomu.
It is said that she built Fukoji Temple in Hirooka, Soegami County, Yamato Province (present-day Horen-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture) for Emperor Shomu.
